title: Pressed​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> ButtonBarElement.Pressed: Signal Signal that's fired when the button is clicked.

title: SetLabel​
content: </> ButtonBarElement:SetLabel(text: string) → () Set the label text.

title: new​
content: </> EffectValue.new( baseValue: number-- The final value when no multipliers are applied ) → EffectValue Constructs a new EffectValue.

title: PushMultiplier​
content: </> EffectValue:PushMultiplier(multiplier: number) → callback-- Call to remove Push a multiplier (i.e. 'effect') onto the base value. All multipliers are multiplied together before being applied. This means they compound. i.e. with multipliers (1, 1, 1) => baseValue * 1. i.e. with multipliers (1, 1.5, 0.3) => baseValue * 0.15.

title: Observe​
content: </> EffectValue:Observe() → Observable<number> Observe the final value, after all multipliers have been compounded.

title: GetValue​
content: </> EffectValue:GetValue() → number Gets the current compounded value.

title: SetBaseValue​
content: </> EffectValue:SetBaseValue( baseValue: number-- The final value when no multipliers are applied. ) → () Set the base value of the effect. Note that this will automatically update the final value, and notify any observers.

title: getFocalPoint​
content: </> FocalPointUtils.getFocalPoint() → Vector3  Gets the focal point via the Workspace.CurrentCamera.

title: observeFocalPoint​
content: </> FocalPointUtils.observeFocalPoint() → Observable<Vector3 > Observes the focal point via the Workspace.CurrentCamera.

title: Observe​
content: </> SliderBarElement:Observe() → Observable<number> Observe the slider's value.

title: SetLabel​
content: </> SliderBarElement:SetLabel(text: string) → () Set the label text.

title: GetValue​
content: </> SliderBarElement:GetValue() → number Get the slider's current value.

title: SoundscapeTrigger​
content: </> SoundscapeBindersClient.SoundscapeTrigger: Binder<SoundscapeTrigger>

title: new​
content: </> SoundscapeTrigger.new(bound: Instance ) → SoundscapeTrigger Constructs a new Soundscape Trigger. Should be done via [Binder]. See SoundscapeServiceClient.

title: CheckAABB​
content: </> SoundscapeTrigger:CheckAABB(point: Vector3 ) → boolean Checks if a point is within this trigger's bounding box.

title: ObserveName​
content: </> SoundscapeTrigger:ObserveName() → Observable<string> Observe the name of the soundscape attached to this trigger.

title: GetVolume​
content: </> SoundscapeTrigger:GetVolume() → number Get the volume of this soundscape trigger.

title: Init​
content: </> SoundscapeServiceClient:Init(serviceBag: ServiceBag) → () Initializes the soundscape service on the client. Should be done via [ServiceBag].

title: Start​
content: </> SoundscapeServiceClient:Start() → () Begins searching for (and playing) soundscapes. Should be done via [ServiceBag].

title: SetMasterVolume​
content: </> SoundscapeServiceClient:SetMasterVolume(volume: number) → () Set the master volume of the soundscape system.

title: RegisterSoundScript​
content: </> SoundScriptRegistryServiceClient:RegisterSoundScript( name: string,-- Arbitrary, just used as a way to identify this SoundScript. soundScript: SoundScript ) → () Registers a SoundScript to be used by SoundscapeTriggers.

title: ObserveSoundScriptBrio​
content: </> SoundScriptRegistryServiceClient:ObserveSoundScriptBrio(name: string) → Observable<Brio<SoundScript>> Observe the contents of a SoundScript given its name inside the registry. If not found, the Observable won't complete.

title: ev​
content: </> SoundScriptUtils.ev( value: nil | number | {number},-- Value to evaluate default: number?-- Fallback value ) → number Evaluates a value defined in a soundscript. Supports defualt values, defined values, and values picked randomly in a range.

title: SoundScript​
content: </> type SoundScript = { reverb: Enum.ReverbType, layers: {SoundEntry}, includes: {SoundScript}? }

title: SoundEntry​
content: </> type SoundEntry = { id: string, loop: boolean?, volume: SoundValue, pitch: SoundValue, delay: SoundValue }

title: SoundValue​
content: </> type SoundValue = {number} | number | nil This is a low-level property for a soundscript. These are evaluated each delay a sound is played. A number in -> The same number out A two-long number array in -> A random value within the range of the two A 'nil' in -> a 'nil' out, falling back to a default value (i.e. volume = 1)

title: city​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> SoundScriptConstants.city: SoundScript Traffic, cars honking, train passing, birds. Echoey reverb like you're between buildings.

title: bumps​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> SoundScriptConstants.bumps: SoundScript Random bump noises, echoey reverb. Probably best used as an include for other soundscapes.

title: office​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> SoundScriptConstants.office: SoundScript Air conditioning, light machine noise, electric light hums. Occasional bumping noises from importing SoundScriptConstants.bumps.

title: forest​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> SoundScriptConstants.forest: SoundScript Subtle wind and birds. Dampened reverb.

title: Gui​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> StoryBar.Gui: Instance?  Gui object which can be reparented or whatever, typically underneath a Horacekat target.

title: new​
content: </> StoryBar.new(serviceBag: ServiceBag) → StoryBar Constructs a new StoryBar. You likely don't want to do this directly, see StoryBarUtils.

title: PushElement​
content: </> StoryBar:PushElement(element: BaseBarElement.) → () → ()-- Cleanup task, call to remove from the bar. Push a constructed [BaseBarElement] onto the StoryBar.

title: makeVisibleSwitch​
content: </> StoryBarPaneUtils.makeVisibleSwitch( storyBar: StoryBar, basicPane: BasicPane, name: string? ) → SwitchBarElement Creates a SwitchBarElement underneath a StoryBar, bound to the visibility of a GUI class inherting [BasicPane]. -- Create UI. local exampleBasicPane = ClassThatInheritsBasicPane.new() maid:GiveTask(exampleBasicPane) -- Bind UI visiblity to switch. local bar = StoryBarUtils.createStoryBar(maid, target) StoryBarPaneUtils.makeVisibleSwitch(bar, exampleBasicPane)

title: createStoryBar​
content: </> StoryBarUtils.createStoryBar( maid: Maid, target: Instance -- Intended to be a Hoarcekat target. ) → StoryBar Create a new StoryBar.

title: createButton​
content: </> StoryBarUtils.createButton( storyBar: StoryBar, name: string, callback: () → () ) → ButtonBarElement Create a button attached to a StoryBar.

title: createSwitch​
content: </> StoryBarUtils.createSwitch( storyBar: StoryBar, name: string, default: boolean, callback: (value: boolean) → () ) → SwitchBarElement Create a switch attached to a StoryBar.

title: createSlider​
content: </> StoryBarUtils.createSlider( storyBar: StoryBar, name: string, default: number, callback: (value: number) → () ) → SliderBarElement Create a slider attached to a StoryBar.

title: createRangedSlider​
content: </> StoryBarUtils.createRangedSlider( storyBar: StoryBar, name: string, lower: number, upper: number, mappedDefault: number,-- The default value, between lower and upper (inclusive). callback: (value: number) → () ) → SliderBarElement Create a slider within a range attached to a StoryBar.

title: Observe​
content: </> SwitchBarElement:Observe() → Observable<boolean> Observe the switch's current value.

content: </> SwitchBarElement:SetLabel(text: string) → () Set the label text.
